intro: Minuartia barkalovii, commonly known as the Siberian rock-cress, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in alpine and arctic regions. Minuartia barkalovii is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
